allReviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Illegal advertising by seller. Terrible Service
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
allReviews.body: Illegal advertising by seller. Package front and back both state: "Unlimited Talk, Text, & Data". But on the front bottom, it states, "3G Data", and the listing details state: "3GB of High-Speed 5G 4G LTE Data." How can it be limited to 3G of data if it clearly states "unlimited data" on the package front and back. I contacted the seller, Ultra Mobile" about this and asked the same question. They referred me to Amazon to complain to you, if I received the wrong SIM card. However, I was starting to message back to them in the chat that I did not get the wrong SIM, I got the one I ordered, but the seller has put misleading info on the package. Before I could even send that reply message, the chat rep from Ultra Mobile ended the chat as soon as they sent me the message saying to contact Amazon about it.Set up was very complicated, took a very long time to try and get this all straightened out. The activation instructions said I have to change the settings for Access Point Names, which was a long process. But it also seemed as though the Access Point Names were automatically configured during activation.I am unable to access voicemail unless I reset network settings to factory default settings on my phone, which I don't want to do, since I am only trying out this SIM on my phone, and plan to revert back to my Tracfone network. If I reset network settings, all data, bluetooth, & wifi settings will be deleted. That would mean that when I reinstall the Tracfone card, I will not be able to access my voicemail on that network, plus I won't be able to log into my wifi or use my previously paired bluetooth devices with my phone.When the phone is initially set up, and I call my home phone from the mobile using the SIM card, it comes up as "April Bailey", which is not me. There is no way to resolve or change this. Ultra Mobile said they would escalate that, but I dont know if they will fix it.I have had two chats with their customer service, which both went about 1 hour. The chat reps seem to be chatting with multiple people at the same time, so their responses usually take a very long time & they never admit to chatting with multiple people simultaneously when asked directly about it. They claim they are checking resources or having system issues. Most of the chat time is spent waiting for them to respond. When I asked why the physical packaging says "unlimited data" on the front and back, while the plan says "3GB of data", they could not explain that and told me to contact Amazon, then they dumped me off the chat without warning, which was so rude and unprofessional. Both chat experiences were bad.I did try calling one of the 80 countries and enjoyed the free call and text on that. But I would not recommend this company due to the above issues. I also reported them to Amazon, who said they would escalate the issue of false advertising.

allReviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
    Funciona en Venezuela.  SMS a veces lento
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
allReviews.body: Al instalar la SIM Ultra Mobile como SIM #2 en el celular Xiaomi, en ajustes (settings) aparece T-Mobile.  Ultra Mobile es un Mobile Virtual Network Operator (MVNO) que compra y revende cobertura T-Mobile.  El 1 de mayo 2024 T-Mobile compró a Ultra Mobile. Compré la SIM con 3GB por $19 mensuales y lo utilicé tres semanas en Texas, Florida, Panamá y Venezuela para llamadas telefónicas, mensajitos, data, WhatsApp etc.  En Venezuela, sí recibo mensajitos de claves de bancos, incluyendo BofA y familiares.   Con roaming, probé llamanado a USA estando en Panamá y Venezuela.  Funciona, pero mejor llamar WhatsApp via WiFi que no tiene costo.A fin de reducir la mensualidad, al vencer el mes, cambié el plan mensual de 3 GB $19 al mínimo, $15 mensual. Al hacer un solo pago de $120 por un año, hay descuento que equivale a precio de $10 mensuales.  Ofrecen seis planes.  Determine el conveniente según el uso que le va a dar.  T-Mobile es mucho más costoso.En Venezuela, Ultra Mobile trabaja con partners Movistar y Digitel, por tanto, nótese que como cualquier celular en Venezuela, depende de la cobertura y congestión del operador local.  A veces los mensajitos tardan en llegar a Venezuela, dependiendo de la hora del día.    Encuentro que entrando y saliendo de modo avión en el teléfono, y también  mensajitos en la app de Google Messages en la computadora con Windows 11, mensajitos parecieran llegar más rápido.Ultra Mobile es buena solución para cobertura internacional, Venezuela incluida.

allReviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Separate the product from the service
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2024
allReviews.body: Okay. I am going to review both the product and the service differently.The sim card is easily activated. You need to be in the US when you activate it. Inside the US, you will get a new phone number and wifi calling needs to be enabled through ultra Mobiles website. It wont work until you do.Now the hard part... the service..i took a vacation in Brazil. My phone worked literally only the first day; I started having issues right after the phone restarted.The problem is that literally every place that i am at (except very close to the airport) is considered to be roaming. If this is the case for you, youll need to go to their website and add international roaming credits for it to work. The current rate is 25 cents usd a minute for talk, and 2 cents per texts. I'm not entirely sure on the data rate....but they do have a support number to call, and they can help you fix issues.Keep in mind, just because you have internet that does not mean you can make calls. Just because you can make calls doesn't mean you have Internet.You need to actually check the coverage maps of wherever you are going and make sure to have roaming credits because you'll never really know when it's needed.To get my phone working in brazil (i have an android), i needed to go to settings, mobile data, then select the SIM card and make sure that the carrier setting was at auto select. This didnt work until i tried to connect to a non functioning network and it tood me to enable automatic registration..after that, the only issues I have are related to my coverage area.5 stars for the sim.3 stars for the service.. I wouldn't have gotten my phone to work without having a technical background.

allReviews.body: We've always had a cellphone service provider in the US. But with extended upcoming international travel, we decided to port our numbers over to VOIP providers and eliminate our cell service.This little sim card did the trick for us. It let us keep access to data when we weren't near a wifi source. When we purchased our phones a couple years ago, we made sure that they were unlocked. This made switching from our carrier's sim to this one a snap.We just followed the directions on the package and had data access in no time. We had no tech issues, so I can't rate tech support, but had a great overall experience.Since we had ported our phone numbers over to a wifi service (one to Google voice, the other to iPlum) we still had access to our regular phone numbers, so the one that came with this sim was irrelevant to us. It was really the mobile data we were after.And given how easily this worked, now we know exactly how we'll fill our data needs on any trips back to the US. 👍  Yay!

criticalReviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Illegal advertising by seller. Terrible Service
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
criticalReviews.body: Illegal advertising by seller. Package front and back both state: "Unlimited Talk, Text, & Data". But on the front bottom, it states, "3G Data", and the listing details state: "3GB of High-Speed 5G 4G LTE Data." How can it be limited to 3G of data if it clearly states "unlimited data" on the package front and back. I contacted the seller, Ultra Mobile" about this and asked the same question. They referred me to Amazon to complain to you, if I received the wrong SIM card. However, I was starting to message back to them in the chat that I did not get the wrong SIM, I got the one I ordered, but the seller has put misleading info on the package. Before I could even send that reply message, the chat rep from Ultra Mobile ended the chat as soon as they sent me the message saying to contact Amazon about it.Set up was very complicated, took a very long time to try and get this all straightened out. The activation instructions said I have to change the settings for Access Point Names, which was a long process. But it also seemed as though the Access Point Names were automatically configured during activation.I am unable to access voicemail unless I reset network settings to factory default settings on my phone, which I don't want to do, since I am only trying out this SIM on my phone, and plan to revert back to my Tracfone network. If I reset network settings, all data, bluetooth, & wifi settings will be deleted. That would mean that when I reinstall the Tracfone card, I will not be able to access my voicemail on that network, plus I won't be able to log into my wifi or use my previously paired bluetooth devices with my phone.When the phone is initially set up, and I call my home phone from the mobile using the SIM card, it comes up as "April Bailey", which is not me. There is no way to resolve or change this. Ultra Mobile said they would escalate that, but I dont know if they will fix it.I have had two chats with their customer service, which both went about 1 hour. The chat reps seem to be chatting with multiple people at the same time, so their responses usually take a very long time & they never admit to chatting with multiple people simultaneously when asked directly about it. They claim they are checking resources or having system issues. Most of the chat time is spent waiting for them to respond. When I asked why the physical packaging says "unlimited data" on the front and back, while the plan says "3GB of data", they could not explain that and told me to contact Amazon, then they dumped me off the chat without warning, which was so rude and unprofessional. Both chat experiences were bad.I did try calling one of the 80 countries and enjoyed the free call and text on that. But I would not recommend this company due to the above issues. I also reported them to Amazon, who said they would escalate the issue of false advertising.

I also purchased 15 GB of data, which I have been unable to activate despite following the instructions in the app. I do have "data roaming" on, but that hasn't fixed it.In order to access customer service, you have to place a call. I cannot place calls, so I cannot reach customer service. I can send and receive text messages, but only when I am connected to WiFi. I can receive calls, but cannot place them. I asked my Professor for help (since he is regularly abroad) but he couldn't fix it either.I've gotten by, but it's far from ideal and kind of scary not to have reliable contact or internet access in a foreign city. I don't recommend this SIM.
